record.title: TRADE ADJUSTMENT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM EXTENSION
record.narrative:
TRADE ADJUSTMENT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM EXTENSION -- (Senate - September 25, 2007)

[Page: S12076]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to the immediate consideration of H.R. 3375, which was received from the House and is at the desk.

record.chair: The clerk will state the bill by title.
The assistant legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (H.R. 3375) to extend the trade adjustment assistance program under the Trade Act of 1974 for 3 months.
record.narrative: There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the bill.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the bill be read the third time, passed, and the motion to reconsider be laid upon the table; that any statements relating thereto be printed in the Record, without intervening action or debate.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The bill (H.R. 3375) was ordered to a third reading, was read the third time, and passed.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Casey.) Without objection, it is so ordered.
